benchmark_details.name: PLACEIT3D
benchmark_details.overview: PLACEIT3D is a benchmark for language-guided placement of 3D assets in real 3D scenes, enabling evaluation of multi-modal large language models (MLLMs) on this task, which involves handling one-to-many placement ambiguities, geometric reasoning, and language understanding.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a foundation for evaluating and advancing multi-modal large language models (MLLMs) in the task of 3D object placement based on natural language instructions.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The benchmark currently focuses on placing objects on horizontal surfaces only and relies on synthetic rule-based optimization without complete human verification for edge cases.

data.source: 3D reconstructed scenes from ScanNet and assets from PartObjaverse-Tiny.
data.annotation: Annotated with all valid placements that can be used for training MLLMs.

methods: Evaluation protocol comparing predicted placements against constraints
Rule-based systems for checking validity of placements
methodology.calculation: Metrics are computed based on the percentage of constraints satisfied across the dataset.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better adherence to constraints and placement accuracy.
methodology.baseline_results: PLACEWIZARD, the proposed method, outperforms baseline methods with improved accuracy in following language instructions.
methodology.validation: Tested against the benchmark evaluation protocol.
